summary: This is a chain of emails from May 2008 between prosecutors/investigators discussing a witness (Mindy) who will invoke her Fifth Amendment right unless granted immunity, and a separate victim who reported that Jeffrey Epstein told her he had sex with a girl named Mindy and didn't care about her age. The emails also discuss scheduling a grand jury appearance and coordination with Epstein's attorneys.

persons.name: Mindy
persons.context: A person who was initially classified as a victim until Epstein's attorneys complained. She is represented by an attorney and will invoke her Fifth Amendment right unless granted immunity. She is also reported to have been a minor with whom Epstein had sex.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation. His attorneys are involved in discussions with prosecutors. A witness reports he had sex with Mindy when she was a minor and stated he didn't care about age.

persons.name: Tommy
persons.context: Attorney representing Mindy. He informed prosecutors she would invoke her Fifth Amendment right without immunity.

persons.name: Jason
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who would attempt to interview a witness prior to putting her in front of the grand jury.

connections.description: Tommy is representing Mindy in the Epstein investigation, as he informed prosecutors about her intent to invoke the Fifth Amendment.
A witness reports that Epstein told her he had sex with Mindy, who was likely 15 or 16 at the time, and that Epstein stated he didn't care about age.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Date
events.description: A grand jury date was scheduled, but Mindy's attorney informed prosecutors she would not be able to make it and would invoke her Fifth Amendment right without immunity.

events.title: Witness Interview Reveals Abuse
events.description: A girl was interviewed who reported that Epstein told her he had sex with Mindy when Mindy was likely 15 or 16, and that Epstein said he didn't care about age.

events.title: Email Coordination on Witness
events.description: Prosecutors exchange emails discussing Mindy's stance, scheduling a grand jury, and a meeting to go over case details.

keyFacts: A witness named Mindy, represented by attorney Tommy, will invoke her Fifth Amendment right unless granted immunity, complicating her testimony.
A separate witness reported that Jeffrey Epstein told her he had sex with Mindy when Mindy was likely 15 or 16 years old.
Epstein reportedly told this witness he 'doesn't care about age,' directly contradicting potential defenses about his knowledge of victims' ages.
Mindy was initially classified as a victim until Epstein's attorneys complained, indicating early defense interference in victim classification.
Prosecutors were coordinating grand jury scheduling and considering a video interview with Mindy as an alternative to grand jury testimony.
